value.title: Help your Power BI report users with an Information Panel

value.title: Sort a Column with a Custom Order in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have previously written about how to sort a column by another column, and I used Month Names as an example. value.title: The Power BI Gateway   All You Need to Know
value.excerpt: Power BI is a data analysis tool that connects to many data sources. Suppose the data source for Power BI is located in an on-premises location. In that case, the connection from the cloud-based Power BI Service to the on-premises located data source should be created with an application called Gateway.

value.title: Why Power BI totals might seem wrong
value.excerpt: A common question is why Power BI totals are inaccurate because they do not display the sum of individual rows. value.title: Design a data¬†model¬†in Power BI¬†
value.excerpt: The process of creating a complicated data model in Power BI is straightforward. If your data is coming in from more than one transactional system, before you know it, you can have dozens of tables that you have to work with. Building a great data model is about simplifying the disarray. A star schema is one way to simplify a data model, and you‚Äôll learn about the terminology and implementation of them in this module. You will also learn about why choosing the correct data granularity is important for performance and usability of your Power BI reports. Finally, you‚Äôll learn about improving performance with your Power BI data models.
